item.description:
Quick update:
The restaurant called me and said that they couldn't sit 10 - so it's down to 8 max....
Also, we'll still meet at Tavern on the Square (Porter) at 7pm but the table is now at 7.45pm (was 8pm).


OK, time for something else a little different and 'grown up'

"T.W. Food" is a very creative, small restaurant in North Cambridge which specializes in locally & organically grown / reared food and prepares a special "Warmth of Summer" tasting menu.
(It's also got 5 stars on yelp.com)

The menu is:
1) Shooter - local duxbury oyster with essence of beet (obviously one for the Aussie palate)
2) Cabbage soup with onion, nutmeg perfumes and gnocchi parisienne
3) Beef tartare - grass-fed Vermont Boyden Farm with chilled coulis of swiss chard
4) Smoked soft shell crab, fried green tomato, kohlrabi and sauce “rémoulade”
5) Napoleon of yellowfin tuna, puff-pastry, creamed corn, zucchini and purple basil
6) Cheese - blue ledge goat, Leicester, Vermont, Camembert au Calvados, Normandy, France
7) Liberty puff-pastry - “chausson” with liberty apples and homemade cinnamon ice cream

This is a fixed menu, so apologies if this is not to your taste...maybe next time.

The menu is $69 each ($95 if you want to go with the wine pairings also)
This is also a chance to dress up a little and be 'grown up' for an evening.

It's a little out of the way so let's meet at "Tavern on the Square" at Porter 'T' at 7pm for an 'aperitif' and then jump in a couple of cabs for the 1 mile ride there. If you prefer to go direct, the reservation is for *****7.45pm******.

As it's a small place, numbers are limited. If you RSVP 'yes', please also send me a text so that I can call you to confirm numbers during Tuesday afternoon.
item.how_to_find_us: Steve will be wearing a sand coloured jacket (though no cravate) (978-289-2364)

group.name: The Boston Expat Aussie Meetup Group

item.name: "Warmth Of Summer" Grand Tasting menu at TW Food
